title: How Do You Measure Your Success/Skill Level in LOL?
body:
I still consider myself new to the game- started playing in December 2015- and after many games, I honestly wonder if I did all right. How do you know if you're any good at this game? Do you judge yourself on your Kill/Death/Assist ratio, win loss record, the letter grade you're given after every game, or some other way?

My win loss record is above 50% (89-69, I think that's 56%), so that's good, I must not be awful, but after some games I honestly don't know if I did well.

And I should have different expectations for myself for every role, right? If I'm support, it's acceptable to have few kills, more deaths, but a ton of assists? ADC should have a ton of kills? etc.?

What are your thoughts on this? Thanks.

If you play a lot, and I mean a LOT, the best way to measure is by rank. KDA is nothing more than a possible contributor to victories. Same for damage dealt/taken, same for CS, same for objectives secured, etc. What truly matters is bringing them all together and getting that win. If you can do it consistently, you'll find yourself winning more than losing. Do that in the most competitive environment the game can offer, you'll find yourself to be challenged to the max. And when you get 200 or so ranked games under your belt, you'll very likely have reached your true Elo for your current skill level.

Unless I play support I rate myself of damage to champs, damage taken, healing done. objectives destroyed If I was the highest in all of those categories, I was our carry, regardless of kills.

Most people just use their rank in ranked (IE Silver V).  It's hard to use any other metric, because they are different for each role. Most people are at around 50% winrate, because that is how the system attempts to match you against opponents you win half the time against.  So if you get better, you usually just get matched against harder opponents.  

If you play mid/top/adc you can look at CS at 20 minutes, but that is not a useful metric if you are playing jg/support.

KDA can be useful, but it depends on context (ie if you are 0/10/0 on tryndamere top, but you took 6 turrets and 2 inhibs, you did well).

With more win than losses you are doing well for a new player. It means you are above the **average skill level of a new player**. However, everything is relative, I don't think you are in the 50% best players of the north american server (you will need to reach Silver 4 to prove that).

What really measure "skill level" is the ranking you will have once you begin ranked matches. Here is an idea of your performance in comparison to other players once you begin ranked:

http://www.leagueofgraphs.com/rankings/rank-distribution

My personal thought is that you never know how good you actually are until you actually start playing ranked, but it also doesn't matter to know how good you are as long as you keep on improving at League of Legends. It doesn't matter to know how good you are now, it just matters that you understand how much better you are now than you were before, even when the results don't always reflect it.

To be honest, I felt like I was a horrible player when I was at your rank. I was losing games left and right, and in the games I actually won I got carried super hard, and it wasn't until like levels 25-26 that I actually started to play half-decently.
Skill level I dunno, but for Success I guess I would measure that by how often I lose or win my lane.
Just pay attention to mistakes you make and learn from it. Dont play every game to win, play to improve and you will outclass everyone.

Once you're 30 a good way to know how you're doing is to, in the end game lobby, look at the rankings of your opponents. Do this for a while and you'll start to get a feel for how good Bronze, Silver, Gold etc. are and how well you do against them. Pre-30, try and focus on what mistakes you used to make and don't make as much anymore. Do you miss out on a lot of CS trying to harass your opponent? Do you face check a lot of bushes and get killed?  Do you ward much or at all? Do you land your skillshots? How many of them? Comparing how you used to do, and how much you've improved is the best way to asses your skills for now.

I mean your rank helps measure your skill to an extent. If you're diamond 2 you're obviously not garbage unless you were duo boosted or you fed every game and SOMEHOW your teammates were gods. 

If you average over like 7 cs/minute and over a 4 or so kda  on your mains then you're probably good compared to people playing st the same level as you. Like if you have those stats in bronze you're better than a majority of bronze players. Doesn't mean you're platinum though because you hard carry silver games.

Also dying as few times as possible is a goal for any role. Your deaths, if you play perfectly, will only be for a greater gain. Example. You die so your ADC gets 3 kills.

Ego. Nothing more. If you're not in LCS you're probably a LOT worse than you think you are and it's common that any group of 5 people can get to diamond.  I haven't found 5 people to play with... but I see it happening.

Frankly, I think cs, kda and gold and level all contribute to how you did in a particular game. It's extremely common and extremely rude how a great many people just think their skills and theirs alone win the game. It's not true. At ANY mmr.
